action.action-desc: Mr. Loudermilk (for himself and Mr. David Scott of Georgia) introduced the following bill
Referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To amend the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 to revise the definition of a facility.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Exchange Regulatory Improvement Act of 2023.
Paragraph (2) of section 3(a) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (15 U.S.C. 78c(a)) is amended to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: The term facility, when used with respect to an exchange, means only—

clause.text: the exchange’s trading systems, which are—

subclause.text: the hardware, software, and related network infrastructure an exchange uses to receive, acknowledge, rank, match, and execute orders in securities traded on that exchange; and
the hardware, software, and related network infrastructure an exchange uses to function as an exclusive processor of real-time market data created by the exchange trading systems;

clause.text: any premises or services made available by the exchange to an exchange member or other person for the purpose of providing physical space and equipment to enable such member or other person to locate the equipment of the member or other person in close physical proximity to the exchange’s trading systems; and

any premises or services made available by the exchange to an exchange member or persons associated with members that exclusively connects such members and persons associated with members to exchange trading systems for the purpose of effecting or reporting a transaction on the exchange.

subparagraph.text: The term facility, when used with respect to an exchange, does not include any properties, premises, or services that can legally be offered by a person or entity that is not required to register as a national securities exchange registered under section 6.
